title: Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument: Fees & Passes
body: Explore This Park    Plan Your Visit     Basic Information     Fees & Passes              Fees & Passes         Please pay your entrance fee upon entering the National Monument NPS Photo  Entrance Fees  An entrance fee is charged for visiting Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument.  Please pay in person at the Kris Eggle Visitor Center, or at one of the self- registration stations along the scenic drives. All federal lands passes are issued and accepted at Organ Pipe Cactus.    Vehicles: $12 (Good for 7 days) This fee includes one motorcycle and rider, or all occupants of a vehicle.  Individuals: $4 (Good for 7 days) This fee applies to bicycles and walk-ins (per person)        Entrance Fee Free Days Each year the National Park Service designates several days as Free Free Days.  On these days all entrance fees are waived at Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument. Camping fees are still required.        The kiosk at Twin Peaks Campground is open in the winter months. During the summer, self registration is available. NPS Photo   Camping Fees Senior and Access passes are honored for a 50% discount on individual campsites.  Twin Peaks Campground: $16 per night Tent and RV camping. No reservations- first come, first served basis. More> Alamo Canyon Primitive Campground: $10 per night Primitive tent camping. More> Backcountry Camping: $5 per permit Register in person at Kris Eggle Visitor Center. More> Group Camping Available by reservation, contact the visitor center at 520-387-6849 x7302 for more information. No senior or access pass discounts on group sites.       All fees collected at Organ Pipe Cactus National Monument are used to help pay for maintenance and interpretive operations. Thank you for your support.
